CatDescriptText: Miss Joan Thomas, 1627 Federal Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 7, 1957, pg.3 with question: "Do you think it justifiable for residents to "put the finger" (notify law enforcement officers) on rackets if they exist in their respective communities?" answer reads: "I think they should; however, this community isn't bad. If the rackets get started, the residents should make certain that they 'put a finger' on them right away."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joan Thomas, wearing light colored coat with three dark buttons, collar, and cuffs, standing on sidewalk in business district with sign for Pittsburgh Paints in background
